The ideal geometry of X-C bond with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ- attraction. The pink ring around X atom corresponds to the electronegative coronary ring caused by the "σ-hole" effect.

elements.content: Scheme 2 The ideal geometry of X–C bond with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ− attraction. The pink ring around X atom corresponds to the electronegative coronary ring caused by the “σ-hole” effect.

elements.content: Fig. 11 Upon the formation of Ag3⋯Clpz motif (dashed red lines), the π–π interactions involving the phenyl substituents and the pyrazolyl rings (dashed green lines) and the steric hindrance may cause the deviation of the geometry of Ag3⋯Cl–C from the ideal one shown in Scheme 2. The structure shown here is based on the crystal structure of 2.
elements.clean_text: Fig. 11  Upon the formation of Ag3⋯Clpz motif (dashed red lines), the π-π interactions involving the phenyl substituents and the pyrazolyl rings (dashed green lines) and the steric hindrance may cause the deviation of the geometry of Ag3⋯Cl-C from the ideal one shown in Scheme 2. The structure shown here is based on the crystal structure of 2.

elements.content: Scheme 3 The ideal geometry of CH3CN with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of overlap of the LUMO of the silver trimer with the sp hybrid orbital of acetonitrile.
elements.clean_text: Scheme 3  The ideal geometry of CH3CN with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of overlap of the LUMO of the silver trimer with the sp hybrid orbital of acetonitrile.

elements.content: The ideal geometry of CH3CN with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of overlap of the LUMO of the silver trimer with the sp hybrid orbital of acetonitrile.The ideal geometry of X–C bond with respect to Au3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ− attraction.Two trimers of [Au(IPh2pz)]3 with the Au3⋯I structural motif highlighted as the dashed red lines. The conformation of 3,5-phenyl rings in the upper trimer makes the less electronegative part of I atom face the partially negatively charged Au3 plane of the lower trimer.
elements.clean_text:
The ideal geometry of CH3CN with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of overlap of the LUMO of the silver trimer with the sp hybrid orbital of acetonitrile.

The ideal geometry of X-C bond with respect to Au3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ- attraction.

Two trimers of [Au(IPh2pz)]3 with the Au3⋯I structural motif highlighted as the dashed red lines. The conformation of 3,5-phenyl rings in the upper trimer makes the less electronegative part of I atom face the partially negatively charged Au3 plane of the lower trimer.

elements.content: Scheme 4 The ideal geometry of X–C bond with respect to Au3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ− attraction.
elements.clean_text: Scheme 4  The ideal geometry of X-C bond with respect to Au3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ- attraction.

elements.content: Fig. 12 Two trimers of [Au(IPh2pz)]3 with the Au3⋯I structural motif highlighted as the dashed red lines. The conformation of 3,5-phenyl rings in the upper trimer makes the less electronegative part of I atom face the partially negatively charged Au3 plane of the lower trimer.
elements.clean_text: Fig. 12  Two trimers of [Au(IPh2pz)]3 with the Au3⋯I structural motif highlighted as the dashed red lines. The conformation of 3,5-phenyl rings in the upper trimer makes the less electronegative part of I atom face the partially negatively charged Au3 plane of the lower trimer.

cln_elements.content: Scheme 2 The ideal geometry of X–C bond with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ− attraction. The pink ring around X atom corresponds to the electronegative coronary ring caused by the “σ-hole” effect.
cln_elements.clean_text: Scheme 2  The ideal geometry of X-C bond with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ- attraction. The pink ring around X atom corresponds to the electronegative coronary ring caused by the "σ-hole" effect.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 11 Upon the formation of Ag3⋯Clpz motif (dashed red lines), the π–π interactions involving the phenyl substituents and the pyrazolyl rings (dashed green lines) and the steric hindrance may cause the deviation of the geometry of Ag3⋯Cl–C from the ideal one shown in Scheme 2. The structure shown here is based on the crystal structure of 2.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 11  Upon the formation of Ag3⋯Clpz motif (dashed red lines), the π-π interactions involving the phenyl substituents and the pyrazolyl rings (dashed green lines) and the steric hindrance may cause the deviation of the geometry of Ag3⋯Cl-C from the ideal one shown in Scheme 2. The structure shown here is based on the crystal structure of 2.

cln_elements.content: Scheme 3 The ideal geometry of CH3CN with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of overlap of the LUMO of the silver trimer with the sp hybrid orbital of acetonitrile.
cln_elements.clean_text: Scheme 3  The ideal geometry of CH3CN with respect to Ag3 plane based on the consideration of overlap of the LUMO of the silver trimer with the sp hybrid orbital of acetonitrile.

cln_elements.content: Scheme 4 The ideal geometry of X–C bond with respect to Au3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ− attraction.
cln_elements.clean_text: Scheme 4  The ideal geometry of X-C bond with respect to Au3 plane based on the consideration of electrostatic δ+⋯δ- attraction.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 12 Two trimers of [Au(IPh2pz)]3 with the Au3⋯I structural motif highlighted as the dashed red lines. The conformation of 3,5-phenyl rings in the upper trimer makes the less electronegative part of I atom face the partially negatively charged Au3 plane of the lower trimer.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 12  Two trimers of [Au(IPh2pz)]3 with the Au3⋯I structural motif highlighted as the dashed red lines. The conformation of 3,5-phenyl rings in the upper trimer makes the less electronegative part of I atom face the partially negatively charged Au3 plane of the lower trimer.

metadata.title: Halogen-involving weak interactions manifested in the crystal structures of silver( i ) or gold( i ) 4-halogenated-3,5-diphenylpyrazolato trimers
